intro: Morrenia connectens var. hunzikeri, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red throat. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. It produces showy blooms in the early morning, hence its common name, and relies on specific pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Morrenia connectens var. hunzikeri is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing or trailing growth habits.
